channel.title: Have anyone ever thought about
channel.description:
Actually updating the game, instead of just throwing in few "custom" features.
Like most of rsc spells are exactly the same, only difference being the power of missiles; whats the point of using earth strike if you are capable to cast fire? For example you could add ice type spells to freeze player or "area of effect" spells to cause damage to all players/monsters in certain area or make monsters weak for certain element (fire giants/demons/dragons could be weak against water spells, bears/wolfs and farm animals weak against fire etc etc etc...
Monsters are probably worst thing in rsc. There is no challenge at all. They can't cast spells, they can't heal, they don't flee (walking few tiles away is not fleeing). They can't even catch you from running away. What's the point?
I think Andrew and his team were rushing too much by adding new "content", so they forgot about actual gameplay features. Just think about it for a moment, would any of you play this game if it wasn't multiplayer? I know i wouldn't.
Player killing is the only thing that has kept this scene alive, of course its good thing, everyone loves it, but besides that there is nothing. Who is the best player of the game? who is the winner? the one who keeps his character logged in on afking spot and the one who clicks mining rock all day long. RSC doesn't even have actual story, quests are pretty much just random tasks. There is no deepness at all and there is no balance.
And before you say "Do it yourself" I'd like to know what you think about all this. Do you enjoy the game as it is, or would you like to move on?

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Temporary group teleportation portal spell and inhibit casting spell code:

Place this at the foot of your spells.xml after the last real entry:

<SpellDef> <reqLevel>99</reqLevel> <type>6</type> <runeCount>4</runeCount> <requiredRunes> <entry> <int>34</int> <int>20</int> </entry> <entry> <int>33</int> <int>20</int> </entry> <entry> <int>38</int> <int>10</int> </entry> <entry> <int>42</int> <int>10</int> </entry> </requiredRunes> <exp>1800</exp> <name>Mystenhaven Portal</name> <description>Summons a portal to Mystenhaven</description> </SpellDef> <SpellDef> <reqLevel>99</reqLevel> <type>2</type> <runeCount>4</runeCount> <requiredRunes> <entry> <int>34</int> <int>20</int> </entry> <entry> <int>33</int> <int>20</int> </entry> <entry> <int>38</int> <int>10</int> </entry> <entry> <int>42</int> <int>10</int> </entry> </requiredRunes> <exp>1800</exp> <name>Inhibit Cast</name> <description>Inhibits casting ability of another player</description> </SpellDef>

Now open SpellHandler.java and find case 45. Above that, paste the code below. If your spell numbers differ, figure it out.

[code]case 49:
if(!checkAndRemoveRunes(owner, spell)) {
return;
}

                    if(affectedMob instanceof Player &&  !owner.isDueling()) {
                        Player affectedPlayer = (Player)affectedMob;
                        owner.setSkulledOn(affectedPlayer);
                          }

                          if(affectedMob instanceof Player) {
            Player affectedPlayer = (Player)affectedMob;
            affectedPlayer.getActionSender().sendMessage("The spell  fails, you may try again in 20 seconds.");
            affectedPlayer.getActionSender().sendSound("spellfail");
            affectedPlayer.setSpellFail();
            affectedPlayer.resetPath();

                Projectile projectile = new Projectile(owner,  affectedPlayer, 1);
                 affectedPlayer.getActionSender().sendMessage(owner  .getUsername() + " has  inhibited your spell casting ability temporarily.");
                          ArrayList<Player> playersToInform =  new ArrayList<Player>();
                           playersToInform.addAll(owner.getViewArea().getPlay  ersInView());
                           playersToInform.addAll(affectedMob.getViewArea().g  etPlayersInView());
                          for(Player p : playersToInform) {
                              p.informOfProjectile(projectile);
                          }
                        break;
                    }[/code]

Now search for:

case 7: // Bones to bananas if(!checkAndRemoveRunes(player, spell)) { return; } Iterator<InvItem> inventory = player.getInventory().iterator(); int boneCount = 0; while(inventory.hasNext()) { InvItem i = inventory.next(); if(i.getID() == 20) { inventory.remove(); boneCount++; } } for(int i = 0;i < boneCount;i++) { player.getInventory().add(new InvItem(249)); } finalizeSpell(player, spell); break;

Below, paste:

case 48: // mystenhaven portal int myWildLvl = player.getLocation().wildernessLevel(); if(world.getTile(player.getLocation()).hasGameObject()) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cannot cast this spell here, please move to a different area."); return; } if(!checkAndRemoveRunes(player, spell)) { return; } if(myWildLvl > 0) { GameObject portal = new GameObject(player.getLocation(), 1155, 0, 0); world.registerGameObject(portal); world.delayedRemoveObject(portal, 300000); player.resetPath(); finalizeSpell(player, spell); player.getActionSender().sendMessage("@gre@You summon a portal to Mystenhaven..."); } else { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You can only cast this spell in the wilderness"); } break;

Now open ObjectAction.java and find:

Above, paste:

else if(command.equals("step into")) { owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You step into the magical pool."); world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(owner) { public void action() { owner.teleport(53, 161, false); owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You have teleported to Mystenhaven"); } }); }

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Aleka, post:26, topic:547219”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=666122.msg4453812#msg4453812 date=1413402205]

malikz:

Your Sig is full of crap.

Aleka:

With all that said I still hate your edgy athiest signature.

[quote=RSCshadow aka the lord of edgville]Get off your moral high-horse. How many other stupid, offensive jokes and insults do people have to put up with here that actually matter? bla bla bla im edgy fear me.

Bro I’ve seen your posts your a fedora wearer yourself. I wouldn’t be surprised if you just started high school. With that said get your self a moral high horse. Your comments are literally retarded you just complain. Go back to your tumblr forums.
[/quote]Expressing that an opinon is “edgy” or held by a “fedora-wearer” has been beaten to death. Nobody cares if you think atheism or feminism or whatever idealogy you’re too busy to actually discuss is “edgy”. If you have nothing substantial to add then don’t bother responding.
[/quote]

Look idiot. Your posts are always negative what have you actually contributed to? Your full of opinions but no results. You are the definition of a moron. I like how you realize your an edgy fedora wearer and don’t deny it. Maybe its best you leave the forum. In case you are too dumb to process what I’m saying, I’m insulting you personally you retard. Everyone has been thinking it its about time somebody told you.

P.S - its spelled ideology. This is the last time I’m going to make a fool out of you on this thread,[/quote]Critizing me still doesn’t make you look like you know what you’re talking about. If you want to insult me, that’s fine; I haven’t been returning the favour. I’m sorry if I came off as rude but it wasn’t my intention. It may be quicker to assume a stereotype but I can assure you I don’t follow your criteria.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

[quote=“Godandjesus, post:16, topic:547219”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=666122.msg4453649#msg4453649 date=1413270779]
Forgive my lack of imagination
[/quote]

Fine. here is few examples.

Frost bolt - Freezes target for few seconds (in case you fail to catch him from running away)
Confuse - Makes target run opposite direction that he is attempting to
Invisibility - Makes you invisible for certain time or until you attack someone.
Phase - Teleports you to random location in 5x5 tile range.
Necromancy - Drains health/prayer from target to you

Each of these spells would have cooldown based on the effect. Note that these are examples that just came to my mind after thinking a minute.[/quote]

I think those are some cool ideas. All those spell imo should be implemented but only for pve not for pvp. Then balancing
shouldn’t be that big of a problem. Also paralyze monster should be removed from the prayer list. KBD and the like should
have to be taken down by a group of players not just one guy with prayer robes and prayer pots.

Also the sig is stupid from any point of view but if you guys want to talk about it find another section.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

You know with a more interesting and strategical combat system, quests could become a lot more interesting. There could be instanced boss battles that actually involve planning and skill rather than just stats and food. Quests themselves in RSC are not only old, but stale and boring with no meaningful rewards besides quest points or the occasional quest item (the rune platebody or dragon items).

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

You should install a spell for casting portals that lasts only 10 seconds before evaporating so clans can have a high level mage able to bale them out before an attacking party arrives to slaughter all of them in the wilderness. To counter that, it should be a high level spell able to inhibit the victim’s spell casting for 30 seconds. Built it before and had fun playing with it but i’m not sure if I’ll be using any magic in Wolf Kingdom or if it will be a more realistic medieval zombie survival game instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Frost bolt - Freezes target for few seconds (in case you fail to catch him from running away) Confuse - Makes target run opposite direction that he is attempting to Invisibility - Makes you invisible for certain time or until you attack someone. Phase - Teleports you to random location in 5x5 tile range. Necromancy - Drains health/prayer from target to you Sleep - Target falls asleep, until he solves captcha or is damaged

These are all things I have implemented except for the Sleep spell, sounds interesting!

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @Godandjesus Godandjesus
item.description:
@Godandjesus wrote:

Well if you cast confuse or freeze while engaged it could just take effect after combat.
Invisibility would work only before you attack or cast on another player, but it couldn’t be used after combat, when opponent has seen you.
And i dont see sleep that overpowered, it could be potential when you attempt to escape, unless your opponent can type fast. I don’t know about others, but i can solve captcha in seconds.

Of course everything needs to be tested in practice, but imo RSC combat needs some twist.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Invisibility and sleep are way overpowered, even with a cooldown.
How do these work once a melee player engages the mage though?

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @Godandjesus Godandjesus
item.description:
@Godandjesus wrote:

Lothy:

Forgive my lack of imagination

Fine. here is few examples.

Frost bolt - Freezes target for few seconds (in case you fail to catch him from running away)
Confuse - Makes target run opposite direction that he is attempting to
Invisibility - Makes you invisible for certain time or until you attack someone.
Phase - Teleports you to random location in 5x5 tile range.
Necromancy - Drains health/prayer from target to you
Sleep - Target falls asleep, until he solves captcha or is damaged

Each of these spells would have cooldown based on the effect. Note that these are examples that just came to my mind after thinking a minute.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy

@lothy wrote:

Sure, but how in your mind is action-oriented stuff reconciled with the turn-based context? Forgive my lack of imagination, but I can’t see it working in a meaningful way.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:13, topic:547219”]I’m not saying you can’t enjoy three round battle mechanics. I’m saying that the paradigm makes it rather meaningless to have things like AOE spells, freezing spells, etc. The whole reason that magic took off in RS2 was that the real-time nature of combat (people being able to run and teleport when they pleased) necessitated it.[/quote]I don’t think implementing AoE-like spells is the only option and I also don’t think that they inherently wouldn’t work in RSC just because they might work better in RS2. Game mechanics don’t have to make sense, they have to be fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’m not saying you can’t enjoy three round battle mechanics. I’m saying that the paradigm makes it rather meaningless to have things like AOE spells, freezing spells, etc. The whole reason that magic took off in RS2 was that the real-time nature of combat (people being able to run and teleport when they pleased) necessitated it.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:8, topic:547219”]Also, regarding being impressed: You’re not impressed now because a) the game if 14 years old, b) you’re not 14 years younger, c) you’ve now been subjected to far more advanced and modern games and gaming systems. Of course you aren’t impressed. How stupid do you have to be to not see the real reason for that though? You’re trying to compare a relic to newer games.[/quote]I’m still impressed by games over a decade old. Fun game mechanics, interesting stories, well-done artistic assets, etc. are timeless. Hell the only thing most modern console games are impressive in are graphics, and even that is starting to get less and less noticeable. Just because RSC is hindered by a few ancient technologies doesn’t mean it doesn’t have the potential to be a good game.

Your Sig is full of crap.
With all that said I still hate your edgy athiest signature.
Get off your moral high-horse. How many other stupid, offensive jokes and insults do people have to put up with here that actually matter?

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @Godandjesus Godandjesus
item.description:
@Godandjesus wrote:

Lothy:

May I direct you guys to the other far larger part of this forum that is RS2 development? They have AOE spells, NPCs with complex behaviour, and so on. And the combat system in RS2 makes that all possibly by not being turn based.

because we love 3 round battle system, rules and simple graphics. There is nothing unique on RS2.

How stupid do you have to be to not see the real reason for that though? You're trying to compare a relic to newer games.

No, im not comparing it to newer more advanced games. I complain about the lack of simple features which could be easily developed. Take a look at old 90’s rpgs, pretty much all of them are more advanced than RSC OR RS2.

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:8, topic:547219”]Lol.

May I direct you guys to the other far larger part of this forum that is RS2 development? They have AOE spells, NPCs with complex behaviour, and so on. And the combat system in RS2 makes that all possibly by not being turn based.

Also, regarding being impressed: You’re not impressed now because a) the game if 14 years old, b) you’re not 14 years younger, c) you’ve now been subjected to far more advanced and modern games and gaming systems. Of course you aren’t impressed. How stupid do you have to be to not see the real reason for that though? You’re trying to compare a relic to newer games.[/quote]

So what you’re trying to say is we should take a classic like pokemon and make it not turn based? You can have custom spells, npc ai and so on without the need to abandon the turn based system. We love the camera, sprites and general game play which is why we are here. If you took rsc and from 2003 and continued to develop it without the graphics overhaul, where would it be? Would they of added runecrafting? New Spells? Notes?

Read full topic

item.title: Have anyone ever thought about
item.dc:creator: @malikz malikz
item.description:
@malikz wrote:

Yeah, from what i remember, most adaptions I’ve seen in this game usually make, or break the game (and they’re not even completed additions to the game). If you’re going to add new features like this, it MUST be balanced out… Subtle, nice additions that compliment the game. This could work, but I think you’d need a logical, open, professional coder willing to adjust and re-adjust these freatures to make it fit right in. I don’t know anyone in this scene with the requirements to go through that kind of hell, to benefit this horrible community, for free. The coder would basically be a game Developer.

To the guy above me… good one. Lol.

Read full topic
